aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm

Class SMTFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm.SMTFactory

  • public class SMTFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The SMTFactory contains the functions and instances that are necessary to derive a GeoNonTermArgument within the GeoNonTermAnalysis. It mainly has two different kinds of methods:
    1. methods to create a FunctionalIntegerExpression (PlainIntegerVariable, PlainIntegerConstant, PlainIntegerOperation PlainIntegerRelation
    2. methods to add assertions to a Z3Solver
    Author:
    Timo Bergerbusch

      • createPointCriteriaVector

        public GNAVariableVector createPointCriteriaVector(Stem stem)
        This method generates a GNAVariableVector for the point criteria of the GeoNonTermArgument.
        It does so by taking the Stem and building a GNAVector of size 2*n where the stem vector is of size n, setting the first n-entry's to the stem vector entry's and the second n entry's as the entry's of the stem vector + s_i for 0<=i<=n.
        Example: for the stem vector (10 2)^T the result would be (10 2 10+s_0 2+s_1)^T
        Parameters:
        stem - the Stem of the GeoNonTermAnalysis
        Returns:
        the GNAVariableVector for the point criteria
        See Also:
        Stem, Loop

      • createRayCriteriaVec

        public GNAVariableVector createRayCriteriaVec(int size,
                                              int lambda,
                                              char varName)
        This method creates a GNAVariableVector for the ray criteria of the GeoNonTermAnalysis.
        Only for the very first ray criteria check this method is called, since otherwise we would have to consider mu and the previous y.
        Example: size = 2, lambda = 3 and varName = 'a' the result would be (a0 a1 3*a0 3*a1).
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the vector
        lambda - the eigenvalue of this entry
        varName - the name this variable should have
        Returns:
        a GNAVariableVector of the mentioned form
        See Also:
        createRayCriteriaVec(int, int, char, String, char)

      • createRayCriteriaVec

        public GNAVariableVector createRayCriteriaVec(int size,
                                              int lambda,
                                              char varName,
                                              java.lang.String mu,
                                              char addVarName)
        This method creates a GNAVariableVector for the ray criteria of the GeoNonTermAnalysis.
        Every except the first ray criteria check calls this method.
        Example: size = 2, lambda = 2, varName = 'b' mu="X0" and addVarName = 'a' the result would be (b0 b1 2*b0+X0*a0 2*b1+X0*a1).
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the vector
        lambda - the eigenvalue of this entry
        varName - the name this variable should have
        mu - the mu-coefficient of the previous variable
        addVarName - the name of the previous variable
        Returns:
        a GNAVariableVector of the mentioned form

      • addAdditionAssertion

        public void addAdditionAssertion(int size,
                                 char last)
        This method creates the addition relation between the ray criteria's and the point criteria, so that the system is consistent.
        It does so by using recursiveAdd(ArrayList) starting with 'a' to last and adds the resulting FunctionalIntegerExpression's to the solver. Example: size=2 and last = 'b' the method creates a0+b0=s0 and a1+b1=s1 .
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the variable space
        last - the last used variable name

      • recursiveAdd

        public aprove.Framework.BasicStructures.Arithmetic.Integer.FunctionalIntegerExpression recursiveAdd(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list)
        This method recursively creates FunctionalIntegerExpression with the ArithmeticOperationType.ADD for all elements of the given list as PlainIntegerVariable using createVar(String).
        Parameters:
        list - a list of variables
        Returns:
        one FunctionalIntegerExpression containing the addition of all list elements

      • addAssertion

        public void addAssertion(GNAMatrix matrix,
                         GNAVariableVector vec)
        This method creates a new assertion for the solver using addAssertion(GNAMatrix, GNAVariableVector, GNAVector) and a GNAVector of the desired size only containing 0's.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the Loop.getIterationMatrix()
        vec - the GNAVariableVector that should fulfill this assertion

      • addAssertion

        public void addAssertion(GNAMatrix matrix,
                         GNAVariableVector vec,
                         GNAVector cons)
        This method create new assertions for the solver by multiplying the given matrix with the given GNAVariableVector and creating one assertion per row as the result of the multiplication <= the corresponding index of the given constants vector. Example: 
                                          ( m00 m01)   (   a0 )       ( c0 )
 matrix*vec <= cons  <=> ( m10 m11) * ( l*a0 ) <= ( c1 )
 
 results in the two assertions:
                m00*a0 + m01*l*a0 <= c0
          m10*a0 + m11*l*a1 <= c1
        It does so by using parseRPNTreeToSMTRule(RPNNode) after computing the RPNNode's using GNAMatrix.mult(GNAVariableVector).
        Parameters:
        matrix - the GNAMatrix
        vec - the GNAVariableVector
        cons - the GNAVector
        See Also:
        parseRPNTreeToSMTRule(RPNNode), GNAMatrix.mult(GNAVariableVector)
